subclusters.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genome instability and DNA replication stress in nuclear DNA as a fundamental cause of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes defective transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair (TC-NER) in nuclear DNA causing accelerated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links homocysteine-induced DNA damage and impaired nuclear DNA repair to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA damage accumulation and exonuclease roles in maintaining nuclear genome stability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of nuclear DNA damage, DNA damage response, and genome maintenance systems.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA double-strand breaks in nuclear DNA as causal drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation and impaired repair in hematopoietic stem cells' nuclear DNA.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses organ-specific genome maintenance and DNA damage responses in nuclear DNA affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation and repair in adult tissue-specific stem cells' nuclear DNA.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers DNA damage response signaling and its role in nuclear genome maintenance and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage to nuclear DNA and its contribution to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of molecular damage including ROS-induced oxidative damage and glycation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage accumulation and its causal role in cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Broad molecular damage accumulation theory including genomic instability, protein damage, and metabolic dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in biological resilience due to accumulated molecular and cellular damage including oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline in stress resistance as a fundamental aging mechanism linked to accumulated damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Damage Accumulation and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links decline of autophagy to accumulation of damaged molecules and mitochondria, increasing oxidative stress and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Segregation and Cellular Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on asymmetric segregation of damaged cellular components during cell division to maintain cell population longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-dependent accumulation of mitochondrial DNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial DNA damage accumulation and declining mitochondrial DNA repair contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes functional decline in mitochondria due to age-related mtDNA mutations and heteroplasmy effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: DNA-PK links DNA damage sensing to mitochondrial loss and metabolic decline, connecting nuclear DNA damage response to mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: DNA-PKcs deficiency impairs DNA double-strand break repair and telomere maintenance, linking nuclear DNA repair defects to mitochondrial and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic instability and somatic mutations in post-mitotic neurons' nuclear DNA contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genome Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genome instability and decline in DNA repair capacity in brain cells leading to aging and neurodegeneration.
